title.rendered: 15 Best Things To Do In Sacramento

content.rendered:
Relocating to ‘America’s Farm to Fork Capital’? A trend that has taken the world by storm is embedded in the history of Sacramento. The city has about 40 farmer’s markets and is known to ship farm produce all over the United States, living up to its nickname!

Sacramento is one of the fastest-growing cities in California. The cluster of universities make it an educational hub, and the ever-evolving contemporary culture paves the way for it to be known as the ‘hipster city’. Whether you’re moving to the city or planning to pay a visit, we will help you build an itinerary, making sure you don’t miss out on all the amazing things there are to do in Sacramento.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Sacramento

Outdoors in Sacramento

1. Discovery Park

Discovery Park sits in the heart of two rivers merging: the American and the Sacramento River. A day out here could include boating, horse riding, biking, fishing amongst many other things. This park is the perfect example of commercialized nature. Gear up for a fun-filled day, as this is one of the best places to visit in Sacramento.

Costs:

Reservation Fee: $40-$250 (for gatherings of more than 40 people)

Vehicle: $5

Vehicle+ Trailer or Oversized Vehicle: $10

Bus: $20

Timings:

Open year round, sunrise to sunset.

Make Reservations

2. RV Park

With all the amazing restaurants in Sacramento just a few miles away, RV Park is an ideal spot for you to relax and take a break from your everyday life. With all the amazing things to do in Sacramento, make sure you experience RV camping along with with your loved ones. Make your trip memorable with the multiple facilities available on the Sacramento River RV Campsite! Living near the water is cool, but doing the same in an RV is cooler!

Costs: Overnight Fee: $30 to $50

Timings: Open all year round.

Make Reservations

3. Mountain Bike Club

The capital of California provides long stretches of single and double-track mountain biking terrains. From easy, flat trails to steep, rocky ones, mountain biking makes for one of the most adventurous things to do in Sacramento! Add to your day-out and bring in some amazing food from the best restaurants in Sacramento like Sunflower Drive-in Cafe.

Costs: Free

Timings: Open all year round.

Explore Trails

Sports in Sacramento

4. Basketball

You are in the home of the ‘Sacramento Kings’, so make sure you include a game at the Golden 1 Center on your itinerary. Apart from watching the game, if throwing the ball interests you, gather your group and head to McKinley Park. Plan your day out and fill the Park-use application in advance to book more exciting things to do in Sacramento!

Costs: Free

Timings: Open all year round.

Visit Website

2. Baseball

McKinley Park is home to many sports, including baseball. Plan your day in this beautiful park, where you can pick from a number of sports to play with your family. You could spend multiple days utilizing this park’s facilities; McKinley is definitely one of the best places to visit in Sacramento.

Costs: Free

Timings: Open all year round.

Visit Website

6. White Water River Rafting

Looking to take some time off from your regular routine? Plan for the amazing things to do in Sacramento with us. Recharge with American White Water Expeditions and raft your way to an amazing weekend getaway!

Costs:

There are about 16 packages. Some listed are listed here:

Tours cost for:
2 hours (half day): $75-$105
Tours cost 3.5 Hours (full day): $100-$124
Tours cost 6 Hours (Day Trip): $115-$139
Two Day Trip: $239-$309

Timings: Depends on your tour

Book Here

Museums in Sacramento

7. California Automobile Museum

The Automobile Museum is home to various classic and modern vehicles from all around the world. Absorb the knowledge of automobile inventions from the past all the way to predictions for the future. Whether you are a car enthusiast or not, you should add this to your list of things to do in Sacramento.

Costs:

Adults: $10
Seniors: $9
Active Duty Military: $9
Students: $9
Children (5-17): $5
Kids under 5: Free
Members: Free

Timings:

Thursday – Sunday
10am – 5pm

Closed: Tuesday, Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Years Day

Visit Website

8. Aerospace Museum of California

Situated in the McClellan Business Park, the Aerospace Museum of California helps you understand the past, present, and future of aerospace inventions. Age is no barrier, as this museum shows you the possibilities of soaring through the skies into space! This is definitely one of the nicest places to visit in Sacramento to have a fun-filled day with your family!

Costs:

$15 General Admission (18+)
$10 Admission (Seniors, Veterans, children 4-17)

Timings:

Thursday – Sunday
9am to 4pm

Closed: Sunday – Monday, New Year’s Day, Easter, Independence Day, Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day

Website

9. California State Railroad Museum

Does the sound of ‘vintage train rides’ excite you? Well, then, don’t miss out on this timepiece of a museum spread over 2.5 acres. Hop on this journey and head towards the history of railways in the United States. Grab souvenirs from the store and make your trip memorable. Among the many places to visit in Sacramento, the feel-good vibe of the State Railroad Museum is suitable for all ages!

Costs:

Adults: $12
Youths (aged 6-17): $6
Children (aged 5 and under): Free 

Timings:

Monday – Sunday
10am – 5pm

Closed: Major Holidays

Website

Culture in Sacramento

10. Theater and Performing Arts

When you’re planning for things to do in Sacramento, don’t miss out on the theater and performing arts scene in the town. Plan your days in advance as the tickets sell out very fast!

Costs:

Visit the website for details on each event

Timings:

Book your event as per the designated dates.

Book Here

11. Farm To Fork

By now you know ‘Farm to Fork’ is a way of lifestyle for America’s ‘Farm to Fork Capital’. In Sacramento, this term has been embedded in history, owing to the 40 farmer’s markets that come together to make the “Tower Bridge Dinner”, amongst many other farm to fork events. This dinner is planned for over 800 guests, and the tickets sell out in seconds. Get ready for the best local dishes made with local produce. Book for the farm to fork events in advance to avoid disappointment later!

Costs and Timings:

Check the website below for all the details on the tour that excites you.

Website

12. Bike and Brew Itinerary

You could pick your tour from multiple options, be it an individual tour or a group one, but either way, this is one of the most amazing things to do in Sacramento with your family and friends. Bike to bars and get the well-deserved discounted rates on your drinks. Gone are the days of pub crawls – this is now the only way to celebrate special occasions!

Costs:

Individual Seat Pricing:
2 Hours: $34.99

Private Bike Pricing:
2-hour tour: $399 and up for up to 15 passengers
3-hour tour: $499 and up for 15 passengers

Timings:

2-3 hour tours

Book Here

Restaurants in Sacramento

13. A Part Cafe

The best ‘Middle-East fusion’ food in town, A Part Cafe should definitely top your must-visit list of restaurants in Sacramento. This vegan-friendly cafe caters to everyone who comes in hungry!

Timings:

Closed: Monday
Tuesday – Saturday: 11am-8pm
Sunday: 11am-6pm

Menu

14. Kabab Hut

Overseen by Zulfiqar “Guddu” Haider, a restauranter who is famous for his other two diners in San Francisco, Lahore Karahi and Guddu ki Karahi! Head to Kabab Hut as Mr. Guddu promises lip-smacking food options to satisfy your South-Asian food cravings. Don’t miss out on the creamy chicken tikka.

Timings:

Closed: Monday

Tuesday-Sunday: 11am-9pm

Website

15. Sunflower Drive-in

Get the most delicious vegetarian meals made with fresh off-the-farm produce and the healthiest of ingredients. The cafe is dedicated to making nutrition tasty – the best choice for you and your loved ones.

Timings:

Summer Hours:
Monday – Closed (Open on holiday weeks)
Tuesday – 10:30-5:00
Wednesday – 10:30-9:00
Thursday – 10:30-9:00
Friday – 10:30-9:00
Saturday – 10:30-9:00
Sunday – 11:00-5:00

Winter Hours:

Monday – Closed (Open on holiday weeks)
Tuesday – 10:30-4:00
Wednesday – 10:30-8:00
Thursday – 10:30-8:00
Friday – 10:30-8:00
Saturday – 10:30-8:00
Sunday – 11:00-4:00

Menu

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find things to do in Sacramento? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
